sentence.Network_cn: 未来的巨城使得正在努力应付目前大城市困难的设计人员感到恐惧.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Latin horrificare, from horrificus (see horrific)

entry.tran: 使感到震惊;使毛骨悚然;使产生反感
entry.def: If someone is horrified, they feel shocked or disgusted, usually because of something that they have seen or heard.

example.ex: His family were horrified by the change.
example.tran: 他的家人对这一变化感到震惊。

example.ex: ...a crime trend that will horrify all parents.
example.tran: 会让所有父母感到毛骨悚然的犯罪趋势

means.word_mean: 1. fill with apprehension or alarm; cause to be unpleasantly surprised;

sentences.sentence: "I was horrified at the thought of being late for my interview"
"The news of the executions horrified us"

auth_sentence.content: She is...ready to take chances that horrify even me.

auth_sentence.content: And that will one day horrify you.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: And that will one day horrify you.

jushi.english: I was horrified by the movie.
jushi.chinese: 这部电影令我毛骨悚然。
